Headlines: Delta CEO cautious over adding new flights amid U.S. COVID-19 spikes
Description: Delta Air Lines  is cautious about adding more flights to its schedule due to spikes in coronavirus cases through the southeast and southwest of the United States, Chief Executive Ed Bastian said in an employee memo on Thursday.

Headlines: New $1 billion fund aims to steer antibiotic companies in tough market
Description: Several large drugmakers including Merck & Co Inc  and Pfizer Inc  on Thursday unveiled a $1 billion fund to bolster struggling antibiotic companies and sustain a pipeline for new treatments.

Headlines: ByteDance evaluates changes to corporate structure of TikTok
Description: ByteDance is looking to make changes to the corporate structure of its short video app TikTok, a company spokesperson said on Thursday.

Headlines: Wells Fargo preparing to cut thousands of jobs: Bloomberg Law
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  is preparing to cut thousands of jobs starting later this year, Bloomberg Law reported https://news.bloomberglaw.com/banking-law/wells-fargo-is-readying-thousands-of-job-cuts-to-start-this-year on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: Exclusive: Crypto exchange Coinbase readies landmark stock market listing, sources say
Description: Coinbase Inc has started plans for a stock market listing that could come as early as this year, making it the first major U.S. cryptocurrency exchange to go public, according to three people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: British retail to lose further 5,000 jobs in blow to economy
Description: Britain's high street faces more than 5,000 job cuts after two of its biggest names said that customers were unlikely to return to their old shopping habits after the coronavirus crisis, in the latest blow to the country's ailing economy.

Headlines: American Airlines delays HK flights over new COVID-19 testing rules
Description: American Airlines Group Inc said on Thursday it delayed flights to Hong Kong, a day after the city introduced mandatory virus tests for all arriving crew members.

Headlines: VW's Skoda boss Maier to step down at end of July
Description: Bernhard Maier, chairman of Czech carmaker Skoda Auto, part of the Volkswagen Group , will leave his post at the end of July after nearly five years, the company said on Thursday.

Headlines: France urges no sackings at Airbus as workers march over jobs
Description: The French government backed union calls to avoid compulsory job cuts at Airbus on Thursday as several hundred workers marched from the company's headquarters to Toulouse-Blagnac airport.

Headlines: TikTok says removed over 49 million videos in second half of 2019
Description: Social media app TikTok said on Thursday it removed more than 49 million videos from its platform in the second half of last year for violating its guidelines.

Headlines: Speedy removal of Huawei would cost UK, operators: Vodafone and BT
Description: Britain's rebound from COVID-19 could be harmed if the government demands a speedy removal of telecoms equipment made by China's Huawei from mobile networks, Vodafone and BT warned on Thursday.

Headlines: Brazilian airline Gol says expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter
Description: Brazil's Gol Linhas Aereas Inteligentes  said on Thursday it expects to lose 3.20 reais per share in the second quarter, and that it could reduce its fleet by 30 more aircraft in 2021-2.

Headlines: Wells Fargo pledges $400 million in support of small business after PPP payout
Description: Wells Fargo & Co  will donate over $400 million toward helping small businesses recover from the coronavirus pandemic, giving away all proceeds from its participation in the Payroll Protection Program.

Headlines: Mexico's Aeromexico sees passenger traffic drop 86.1% in June
Description: Mexican carrier Aeromexico said on Thursday that passenger traffic dropped 86.1% in June when compared to the same month the previous year after the coronavirus pandemic eroded demand for air travel.

Headlines: The man who led Wirecard into insolvency
Description: On the night of June 18, Wirecard AG’s new compliance chief stayed up late at his office in the company’s low-rise headquarters in the Munich suburb of Aschheim to pore over the payment firm’s books.

Headlines: Alstom offers French factory sale to clinch Bombardier deal
Description: France's TGV high-speed train maker Alstom  on Thursday offered to sell a French rail factory and make other concessions to win European Commission approval for its planned purchase of Bombardier Inc's  transportation business.

Headlines: Malaysia's AirAsia seeks nearly $500 million in funding: report
Description: Malaysia's AirAsia Group Bhd is looking to raise 2 billion ringgit ($469 million), its CEO was quoted as saying by the Nikkei Asian Review on Thursday, a day after its auditor cast doubt on the airline's ability to continue as a going concern.

Headlines: British retailer Boots to cut 4,000 jobs
Description: Health and beauty retailer Boots, one of the best-known names on Britain's shopping streets, plans to cut 4,000 jobs and close 48 optician stores, in the latest major blow to the country's retail sector from the COVID-19 crisis.
